pr_title: refactor class and name based resource name caching

timeline.bodyText: I noticed based on the contents of serviceNames and operationNames in a customer heap dump, and afterwards consulting the AWS SDK, that caching the resource name would be very low cardinality and a quick win.
timeline.author: richardstartin

timeline.message: refactor class and name based resource name caching
refactor class and name based resource name caching
use CharSequence for cacheable values, which saves a lot of UTF-8 conversions
use CharSequence for cacheable values, which saves a lot of UTF-8 conversions
use CharSequence for cacheable values, which saves a lot of UTF-8 conversions
no longer expect the operation name to be a string during serialisation
address more tests which assumed resourceName was a string

timeline.bodyText:
why you called this just Function ?
In disregard your comment:
https://github.com/DataDog/dd-trace-java/pull/1759/files#diff-3438fdfbe14e3ba1c3a3e78ef37f7637R3
timeline.author: lpriima

replies.bodyText: It's different. This is a function. We will search and replace datadog.trace.bootstrap.instrumentation.api.Function with java.util.function.Function when we drop JDK7. The other one differs to BiFunction in its interface.
replies.author: richardstartin
